revised_title: Stomatal Density Response to Glacial Environmental Change
tldr: The study examines how stomatal density in the arctic-alpine shrub Solix L. has responded to past changes in atmospheric CO2 concentration. The research shows that stomatal density decreased in response to long-term increases in atmospheric CO2 levels, indicating that plants adapted to past environmental changes. This understanding can help predict how plants may respond to future global environmental changes.
